thread.title: Future Fund returns may slow: Costello
thread.title_full: Future Fund returns may slow: Costello

title: Future Fund returns may slow: Costello
text:
Future Fund chair Peter Costello has warned it future returns may be lower than in recent years future as global central banks move towards more normal interest rate levels. 
The fund reported a return of 15.4 per cent over the 2014/15 financial year, generating $15.6 billion. 
This lifted the total value of the fund to $117.2 billion. 
"Prudent, patient investing has been key to navigating markets since the fund was created in 2006," Mr Costello, the former Liberal treasurer who was architect of the fund, said on Wednesday. 
However, the enormous stimulatory policy measures being pursued by central banks in recent years that have helped to drive strong rises in asset prices cannot be sustained indefinitely, he warned. 
"It seems likely that generally returns in the future will be lower than in recent years," he said releasing the fund's latest portfolio update. 
The fund's managing director David Neal said while pleased with the 2014/15 result, he is also conscious of a somewhat mixed global economic and market outlook. 
"This year we have taken advantage of strong markets to reduce our listed equities exposure ... we have been moderately reducing the total portfolio risk," he said. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Google refines logo AAP
